bitfield.description: Customer IP set control0 - All IPs enabled1 - Customer IP set disabled (PWM24-31,CMPSSA6-9,CMPSSB6-9 disabled)
Customer protected features inside PWM IP 0 - All features enabled1 - Customer defined features are protected
CANFD disables. Bit positions correspond to CAN instance. 0 - CAN is enabled1 - CAN is disabled
ICSSM IP disable0 - ICSSM enabled1 - ICSSM disabled
2x control IPs enabled0 - 1x control IPs (refer to PRD for the IP counts)1 - 2x control IPs (refer to PRD for the IP counts)
ROM PBIST ENABLE C ONTROL0 - PBIST DISABLE1 - PBIST ENABLE
Enabling halting of the HSM operation on a ROM ECC error that is detected.

Selects output voltage level from 1.46V to 1.86V; default code is 1.8V
Bit0: Debug feature, doubles the current of the 2nd stage. enfbres_pwdBit6-1: adjust current bias for the 1st, 2nd and 3rd stages.trim_ampbias[5:0]

Bit0: Debug feature, doubles the current of the 2nd stage. enfbres_pwdBit6-1: adjust current bias for the 1st, 2nd and 3rd stages.trim_ampbias[5:0]
Override EFUSE Value with SW ValueWrite 3'b000 : EFUSE ValueWrite 3'b111 : MMR Value

Main LDO(1.8v) Config signals.Bit15: Not UsedBit14: 1 Double current in clampBit13: 1 Local ~200uA load resistor connected to ldooutBit12: 1 Amplifier ok bypassedBit 11-10: Adjust master current mirror in amplifier 2'b11 = 0.67x current 2'b10 = 0.5x current 2'b01 = 2.0x current 2'b00 = 1.0x currentBit9: 1 Allows higher slewing current (should only assert after bootup)

Bandgap DFT controls for debug purposes.Bit7: 1 To short large BJT base resistor to GNDBit6: 1 To short small BJT base resistor to GNDBit5: 1 To turn OFF startup pull NMOSBit4: 1 To turn OFF startup currentBit3: 1 to adjust(increase) BGAMP biasing

Enables adc reference 0, mask hhv before enable000: Disable111 : Enable
Enables adc reference 0, mask hhv before enable000: Disable111 : Enable
enables reference comparators (ROK1). This monitors adc3 & adc4 refernc
enables reference comparators (ROK0B). This monitors adc1 & adc2 refernce
enables reference comparators (ROK0). This monitors adc0 refernce
Mask the Ana ISO generating SOC reset due to a glitch on VDD OK.Used during Trim updates to the analog or during ADC Refbuf enable
VMON FILTER control select00 : no filtering (default)01 : filtering for 4.8us10 : filtering for 9.6us11 : filtering for 14.4us
sensor mux hiz control0 : normal operation. Mux will select either one of the anlaog sensor 1 : mux will be high impedence
number of wait clock cycles between each TMPS Readout. Configure a Non zero value as delay value since configuring 0 is not allowed
Sensor Selection sensor enable bits for each sensor 0 : sensor disable 1 : sensor enablebit 3: temp_sensor3bit 2: temp_sensor2bit 1: temp_sensor1bit 0: temp_sensor0
temperature Sensor 1 cold event detect0 : event not occured1 : event occurred

Efuse override000 -- Value from EFUSE is used as tshut hot and tshut cold thresholds111 - Overide value takes effect
tshut hot threshold. Reads efuse value untill overwritten with override = 111
tshut cold threshold. Reads efuse value untill overwritten with override = 111

Bandgap disable signal.1'b0 = Bandgap enabled. 1'b1 = Badgap disabled
Bandgap flipen control for amplifier offset correction during trimming.1'b0 => normal operation; 1'b1 => AMP inputs flipped.

Selects analog signals for atestoutput for each of the test modes of the safety comparators according to test mode controlled by tb_ctrl_1p1v<83:82> : Test Mode 1 (tb_ctrl_1p1v<83:82>='b01): C5 & C20: HIZ 1: vssa of C5; 2:vth_lo of C5; 3: vth_hi of C5; 4:vssa of C2;5:vth_lo of C2; 6: vth_hi of C2; 7:HIZTest Mode 2 (tb_ctrl_1p1v<83:82>='b10): C3 & C80: HIZ 1: vssa of C3; 2:vth_lo of C3; 3: vth_hi of C3; 4:vssa of C8;5:vth_lo of C8; 6: vref of C8 (1.2V*0.5); 7:HIZTest Mode 3 (tb_ctrl_1p1v<83:82>='b11): C1 & C00: HIZ 1: vssa of C1; 2:vth_lo of C1; 3: vth_hi of C1; 4:vssa of C0;5:vmon of C0; 6: vref of C0 ; 7:HIZSelects Analog Test Signals for Temperature Sensor if tb_ctrl_1p1v<81> is enabled (refer to the spec for details).
Enables three different test modes for safety comparators: 00: HIZ01: Test Mode1 enable10: Test Mode 2 enable11: Test Mode 3 enable
Analog test mode enable for temperature sesnsor
atest enable pins for PMU. Only one bit should be high at a time.system boot logic atest enabled.
Common atest channel selection bits for bandgap, sysboot and LDO.Decoded to enable 8 channels of each module.

2 b00 = MSB (default)2 b01 = LSB2 b10 = Enable2 b11 = compout
1 b0 = dtb connected for compL (default)1 b1 = dtb connected for compH
2 b00 = atb off (default)2 b01 = atb enable for compL2 b10 = atb enable for compH2 b11 = both ATB active

4 b0000 = 1p8v testana isolated (default)4 b0001 = vref_int4 b0010 = vref_low4 b0011 = vdac<0>4 b0100 = vdac<1>4 b0101 = vss4 b0110 = ibias 10uA ( atleast 1.25v at the pad)4 b0111 = por_ibias 10uA (atleast 1.25v at the pad)4 b1000 = cmp out1_p4 b1001 = cmp_out1_n

For: compssa_L POS IN // NEG IN2 b00 = POS Mux control // DAC (default)2 b01 = ATB // DAC (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b10 = POS Mux control // ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b11 = POS Mux control // DAC - ATB shorted (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)For: compssa_H POS IN // NEG IN2 b00 = inh // NEG Mux control (default)2 b01 = ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1) // NEG Mux control2 b10 = inh // ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b11 = inh // DAC - ATB shorted (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)
1 b0 = compout is connected to internal comparator (default)1 b1 = compout is equal to compout_bypass_val

For: compssa_L POS IN // NEG IN2 b00 = POS Mux control // DAC (default)2 b01 = ATB // DAC (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b10 = POS Mux control // ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b11 = POS Mux control // DAC - ATB shorted (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)For: compssa_H POS IN // NEG IN2 b00 = inh // NEG Mux control (default)2 b01 = ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1) // NEG Mux control2 b10 = inh // ATB (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)2 b11 = inh // DAC - ATB shorted (tb_ctrl_1p1v<1> = 1'b1)

Proxy0 access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
EOI vector value. Write this with interrupt distribution value in the chip.

Fault Type 10_0000 = Supervisor read fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype != 1 01_0000 = Supervisor write fault - priv = 1 dir = 0 00_1000 = Supervisor execute fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0100 = User read fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0010 = User write fault - priv = 0 dir = 0 00_0001 = User execute fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0000 = No fault
Fault clear. Writing a 1 clears the current fault. Writing a 0 has no effect.
